Description: Limestone stela: roughly-shaped stela of poor-quality limestone, rounded at the top and extensively pitted by weathering. The stela bears an inscription in low relief giving the name Sesherka below which is a figure of a seated woman.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Djer, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: Bibliography: British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl.2; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pls. XXVI, 79; XXIXA, 79.
